data.title: Poor pizzas
data.text: Service is ok and stuff is friendly. Pizzas are pretty tasteless. Would not visit again nor recommend.

data.title: just average
data.text: Get pasta, not pizza at this place.  Pasta is OK, pizza is salty.  Food is OK, but just average, noting special.

data.title: Birthdays Dinnef
data.text: We aways enjoy our dinner at Pasta "P". We have a  "Pasta Pomodoro Card", which earns you points. Points can be for free dishes.  Servings are large enough to take some home. They also a good wine selection. You will  enjoy!

data.title: Horrible Dinner
data.text: I ordered Chicken Angel Hair Pomodoro my dinner was soaked in olive oil, I send it back and the manager offer to replace my dinner I said ok, she didn't even apologized the cashier was missing all her front teeth I don't mean to be so rude but makes    customers loose their apetite, and the worst it gave diarrhea. I wouldn't never go back, look at the napkins soaked in olive oil so gross

data.title: Arrivederci Pasta Pomodoro
data.text: Hadn't been here for a while.  In town visiting friends and met them at PP for lunch.  Bread and green "dippy" sauce very good . . . the other news - spendy for chain Italian restaurant ($14 for SMALL pepperoni pizza?!  $21 for 6-7 ravioli?!). Spinach salad was a fair price and no extra charge for the long black hair sitting atop it🙀.  Waitstaff brought me a new, hairless one.  Place was nearly empty nonetheless there seemed to be a certain urgency in having us order and eat.

data.title: Always a good meal in Sunnyvale
data.text: We enjoy Pasta Pomodoro for a family night out - consistent, good food, lots of vegetarian options, fun dessert choices, yummy bread and dipping sauce. sign up for their email and get great coupons

data.title: Italian food chain store - better than some
data.text: I've traveled across the US and have found a Pasta Pomodoro restaurant in at least 50% of the cities where I have stayed.  Although not as impressive as the Maggiano's Italian restaurant chain, it serves the standard Italian food fare - spaghetti, ravioli, lasagna, and dishes like that.  Combine with breadsticks, a nice beverage and some friends, and you'll have a good time!

data.title: This is authentic Italian
data.text: May be too authentic so it didn't taste too well for me or may be I took the wrong dish. Everybody else enjoyed so I guess it is a good restaurant.

data.title: Reliable Good Italian
data.text:
When I used to live in San Francisco in the early 2000's, pasta pomodoro just started their expansion. Back then, they made good Italian food that's reliable & consistent, represented good value, & showcased in a nice atmosphere.  Fast forward 15 years, this outlet in Sunnyvale is just as good as it was back then.

Since I start living in this neighborhood, pasta pomodoro has became, again, my go-to Italian. We have had minestrone soup (good), spaghetti Bolognese (good), chicken broccoli Alfredo (good), chocolate lava cake (good). With the bread, they serve it with a slightly sour pesto sauce that is simply delicious & addictive.

Service is efficient & prompt, although not super friendly.

data.title: Good Italian food in a chain restaurant
data.text: Good portions and tasty food. The ambience is somewhere between a diner and a casual dressing restaurant. Been to other location as well and was equally satisfied. The special was Salomon in lemon sauce with capers, liked it a lot. Kiddo had pasta in red sauce which he gulped down readily. Will make another trip to try other entrées for sure.

data.title: Too expensive now !!
data.text: I was used to go there for a quick lunch for a special salad with SAUTÉED SHRIMP at $ 8.99 last spring.... it's jump now at almost double price... why ? they put more salad in it, less shrimps and a very tasteless sauce. Very disappointing and  no friendly service.

data.title: Enjoyed my meal.
data.text:
Pasta Pomodoro in Sunnyvale is my place to go for pasta. My friends and I go there form time to time to enjoy good meals and good service. The staff is very accommodating and nice. We never had a bad experience there. I love their warm bread with pesto souse and pasta. 
The only problem this place is located in a shopping area and sometimes it's hard to find parking.

data.title: Great place to take friends and family for a summer meal
data.text: We like to eat here during the summer months. It has a great family atmosphere and the food is consistently delicious. I would recommend this place to everyone.

data.title: Bad Choice for Later Evening Dining
data.text: We had a group of 8, fairly close to closing time.   The Siciliane was bad and had to be sent back which the waitress replaced happily but none of the food was really good.  We left one untouched pizza and were generally disappointed in the pasta selections.  One of our party arrived late and was told she couldn't order as the kitchen was closing.  Actually, lucky for her. Some in the party enjoyed the fresh bread.

data.title: A good experience!
data.text: I been going to this Pasta Pomodoro in the past. The place is nice and the food, too. But, nothing out of the ordinary! I believe use to much better than lately!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Good food. Great service.Wonderful ambiance. Authentic Italian food. My daughter love their Alfredo with extra mushroom and added chicken.

data.title: Noisy Italian Cafe
data.text: Though this place is close to home, we had never visited.  All the staff were welcoming. Sadly the place was full which  also meant it was very loud.  Our waitress was perfect in serving us, answering questions and appearing at just the right time. The food, though good, wasn't worth the price.  We won't return.

data.title: Good, italian's opinion
data.text:
I am from Italy and I tried this restaurant during my staying in Sunnyvale. The pasta was quite good (not over-cooked, and with the right amount of salt). The tapping was quite good.
Very good Tiramisu!

data.title: Changed my mind about this one recently
data.text: I never liked going here when it first opened.  My kids loved it and would always request it and I would always try to get them to change their minds.  But recently I have changed my mind.  I have gone it there for a fast meal about three times now, and have found a couple of things on the menu that are quite good.  The bread they bring to you before dinner is outstanding and quite addictive.  This is not on the same caliber as Il Postale in Sunnyvale, but it doesn't cost as much either.  This is a place where families can go for a quick meal, nothing fancy.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We got back twice....Nd ech time the food is excellent....serve is great, no the lemonade is so good....parking is not the best because of the trader's joe.
